thread.title: Broad Art Museum at Michigan State University opens 'Moving Time: Video Art at 50'
thread.title_full: Broad Art Museum at Michigan State University opens 'Moving Time: Video Art at 50' - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Associated Press
title: Broad Art Museum at Michigan State University opens 'Moving Time: Video Art at 50'
text:
EAST LANSING, Mich. - An exhibition exploring the past five decades of video art is making its debut at the Eli and Edythe Broad Art Museum at Michigan State University.
"Moving Time: Video Art at 50" opens Saturday at the museum on the school's East Lansing campus. It includes video art by Andy Warhol, Nam June Paik and others. It runs through Feb. 14 and is scheduled to travel to the China Central Academy of Fine Arts in the spring.
The exhibition also features an installation showcasing works by five video artists — including Sam Jury and Michelle Handelman — alongside works that inspired them.
The exhibition in part seeks to prompt visitors to contemplate the progression of video art over time. Several public and educational events are planned.
